TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> We would rather our members not try to sell things to each other. It would attract an undesirable element, and there's enough advertizing on the internet already. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

10-4.  I thought that'd be the case but just wanted to make sure.

I have to ask.

Every time I turn around, it seems we have another new member named:

*<insert city="" here=""> escort girl... call girl... whatever...</insert>*

Or something to that effect. Now, yes, I know what it is, and that it's probably automated, and you Moderators will delete it ASAP...

That's not my question... My question is this...

Just how many of these stupid things does the forum get a day???
I think the more pressing question here, is... why was [@Just Jim](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/148725-just-jim/) looking up those names in the *first* place? ಠ\_ಠ

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, CatastrophicFailure said:
> 
> 
> I think the more pressing question here, is... why was [@Just Jim](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/148725-just-jim/) looking up those names in the *first* place? ಠ\_ಠ
> 

No, I wasn't... bottom right hand corner of the main forum page always shows the newest member... and it seems the last few weeks every other one is one of those spam-girls...

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-27T00:30:12Z" title="01/27/2018 12:30  AM" data-short="6 yr">January 27, 2018</time> by Just Jim**

>

> 
> 
> No, I wasn't... bottom right hand corner of the main forum page always shows the newest member... and it seems the last few weeks every other one is one of those spam-girls...
> 

Uh huh, suuure it....

Oh.

So it does. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif ":blush:")

Never noticed that before.

Wow, 183,000 members.

Oh, well, carry on...![:unsure:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_unsure.png ":unsure:")

Yup... and it seems like every morning, for the last few days, I've logged on to see one of those... that's why I was curious how often it actually happens.

> > > 1 hour ago, Just Jim said: > > > Yup... and it seems like every morning, for the last few days, I've logged on to see one of those... that's why I was curious how often it actually happens. > Haven't noticed. Every time I've looked down there it seems legit. Maybe it in coincides with you being online. Maybe your computer is infected with member-creating-spamware! Or maybe it's YOU DOING IT ALL ALONG. ![macklin-pregnant.gif](https://s.aolcdn.com/hss/storage/midas/cfcb4362133b9432128e35520574767e/205254345/macklin-pregnant.gif)

So there has been a bunch of these stupid things recently... and it's not just me???

Another question, used to be when I got a pm notice it took me to the last unread pm... now it takes me to the first page. Which is a little aggravating when I have some pm conversation's that are dozens of pages long. What changed?

> 
> 
> 41 minutes ago, Just Jim said:
> 
> 
> Another question, used to be when I got a pm notice it took me to the last unread pm... now it takes me to the first page. Which is a little aggravating when I have some pm conversation's that are dozens of pages long. What changed?
> 

Yeah, this! I thought it was just me!

I'm not seeing anywhere I could change it, but when I click on a private message, it defaults to the first page.  This seems odd, I would think it would default to the last page so I can see the reply without having to manually go to the last page.

Is that something that can be changed, or am I doing something wrong?

> 
>

Hi all, I went on to the forums about half an hour ago, and was met by a '502 Bad Gateway' error thing, with an n/ginx thing or something. What is it, and why did this happen? Was it only me who got this, or was the whole website down.
I've seen that a few times over the last week or so.  I've heard that the site is undergoing tweaks, so it's probably just some service being restarted when it goes out momentarily like that.
